oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1955-12-03 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 2 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from December 3, 1955. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Cowboy Copas (host/performer) with Kathy Copas and Floyd Robinson, guest performer Jim Reeves, and regular performers the Old Hickory Singers, Tommy Jackson, Lew Childre, Chet Atkins, Rod Brasfield, Don Slayman, and Gordon Terry. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Rod Brasfield; Jim Reeves; Don Slayman; Gordon Terry; Tommy Jackson; Cowboy Copas; Kathy Copas; Floyd Robinson
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Cowboy Copas introduces Rod Brasfield -- Comedy routine (Rod Brasfield, Cowboy Copas) -- Cowboy Copas introduces Jim Reeves -- Yonder Comes A Sucker (Jim Reeves) -- Cowboy Copas and Jim Reeves introduce Don Slayman, Gordon Terry, and Tommy Jackson -- Silver Bells (Don Slayman fiddle, Gordon Terry fiddle, Tommy Jackson fiddle) -- Cowboy Copas introduces Kathy Copas and Floyd Robinson -- Blue Yesterday (Cowboy Copas, Kathy Copas, Floyd Robinson) -- Closing theme -- Closing statement (Cowboy Copas) -- Cavalier Cigarettes commercial -- Station announcements
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); Turner, Grant; Copas, Cowboy; Copas, Kathy; Robinson, Floyd; Brasfield, Rod; Jackson, Tommy; Childre, Lew, 1901-1961; Atkins, Chet; Old Hickory Singers; Slayman, Don (Musician); Terry, Gordon; Reeves, Jim
